text: PoW Beer Fest, Farnborough. Syrupy, pear aroma. A hint of toffee. Surprisingly dark. Super frothy white head. Sweet, smooth. Velvet. Goes down well. Baked pears. Good stuff.
Bag in box @ Bree Louise, Euston NW1. Pours a hazy yellow golden color with no head. Has a fruity spicy pear aroma. Fruity spicy earthy pear flavor. Has a fruity spicy earthy pear finish.

Half pint BIAB @ The Salopian Bar, Shrewsbury. Pours clear amber. Wood varnish aroma. Taste is rich, golden and big flavoured. Slight dryness coming through but definitely a good perry complexity present. Very decent.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2016 Re-rating elegant and smooth perry at the White Horse in Clun. 
Previous rating on cask in Dartmouth. 7+2+7+4+15 =3.5  Golden with no head and no bubbles. Probably smells and tastes as much of apples as of pears. Lovely palate, rich and tangy texture and refreshing, despite it being a sweeter than usual Perry.
Cask, hand-pulled, Guildford Arms (22 May 2015), fruity aroma, clear yellow, thin white head, apple, pear flavour, sweet, very easy to drink

Sampled at Dr Phils Real Ale House. Light golden in colour, no head and quite a sour nose - still. Quite sharp and a little drying on the mouth at the end. Quite nice flavours but still much prefer a french style perry.

Bag in a box at Firkin Alehouse Folkestone. Clear gold still. Medium medium sweet perry. Some pear fruit juice. sweetish. Not a huge amount of character. Not sure its made of perry pears. Highly drinkable though.

Very pale amber perry. Still. Aroma of pear skins and some slight tannin. Taste is pear juice, a touch of apple skin and sweet sugar. A little oil on the palate. Ok perry.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Cask pretty bricks Walsall. Light gold colour. Aroma is pear apple. Taste is nice sweetness mellow pear flavours sweet finish. Nice juice like body. Could do with a bit more acidity in the finish but v god otherwise.

From bag in box at The Marlborough Arms, Cirencester, Gloucs. Gold with no head. Quite a sweetish perry for me and oddly with a light apple character, quite a fullish palate, there is a skinny finish. Its fine.
